snippet.title: One critical after Melbourne plane crash
snippet.content: One person is fighting for life after a flying-school plane crashed southeast of Melbourne, with another person trapped. Ambulance Victoria says the aircraft crashed at Clyde North at about 10.40am on Thursday, with one person in a critical condition. A man believed to be in his 30s is trapped in the plane with neck, chest and back injuries but is in a stable condition. Two air ambulances have been dispatched. The Australian Maritime Safety Authority spokesman said it was a "flying school plane" from Moorabbin. Police and firefighters are also at the crash site.
